publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-840 Marlyn Glen: 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee-That the Parliament congratulates Dundee City Council on its decision to introduce 20 mph speed limits in the area of all of its primary and secondary schools; regards this decision as an important step in improving road safety amongst both school children and road users in and around schools, and further regards it as a step towards the successful accomplishment of the Scottish Executive's target of reducing by half the number of children killed or seriously injured in road accidents by the year 2010.

S2M-840 Marlyn Glen: 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee-That the Parliament congratulates Dundee City Council on its decision to introduce 20 mph speed limits in the area of all of its primary and secondary schools; regards this decision as an important step in improving road safety amongst both school children and road users in and around schools, and further regards it as a step towards the successful accomplishment of the Scottish Executive's target of reducing by half the number of children killed or seriously injured in road accidents by the year 2010. Supported by: Kate Maclean*
S2M-840 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee (lodged on 29 January 2004) John Swinburne*
S2M-840 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee (lodged on 29 January 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-840 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee (lodged on 29 January 2004) Karen Gillon*
S2M-840 20 mph Speed Zones Around Schools in Dundee (lodged on 29 January 2004) Sarah Boyack*
